intro: Crepis spathulata, commonly known as the spoonleaf mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy habitats and has a rosette of spoon-shaped leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Crepis spathulata is often found in meadows and along stream banks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
